t: Joel 1
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Joel son of Pethuel.
An Invasion of Locusts
Hear*pn this, you elders; listen,*ld all who live in the land. Has*ln anything like this ever happened in your days or*ld in the days of your ancestors?
Tell*ln it to your children, and*ld let your children tell it to their children, and*ld their children to the next generation.

What*ln the locust swarm has left the*ld great locusts have eaten; what*ln the great locusts have left the*ld young locusts have eaten; what*ln the young locusts have left other*ld locusts have eaten.
Wake*pn up, you drunkards, and weep! Wail,*ld all you drinkers of wine; wail*ln because of the new wine, for*ld it has been snatched from your lips.
A*ln nation has invaded my land, a*ld mighty army without number; it*ln has the teeth of a lion, the*ld fangs of a lioness.
It*ln has laid waste my vines and*ld ruined my fig trees. It*ln has stripped off their bark and*ld thrown it away, leaving*ld their branches white.
Mourn*pn like a virgin in sackcloth grieving*ld for the betrothed of her youth.
Grain*ln offerings and drink offerings are*ld cut off from the house of the Lord.*s The*ln priests are in mourning, those*ld who minister before the Lord.*s
The*ln fields are ruined, the*ld ground is dried up; the*ln grain is destroyed, the*ld new wine is dried up, the*ld olive oil fails.
Despair,*pn you farmers, wail,*ld you vine growers; grieve*ln for the wheat and the barley, because*ld the harvest of the field is destroyed.
The*ln vine is dried up and*ld the fig tree is withered; the*ln pomegranate, the palm and the apple tree— all*ld the trees of the field—are dried up. Surely*ln the people’s joy is*ld withered away.
A Call to Lamentation

Put*pn on sackcloth, you priests, and mourn; wail,*ld you who minister before the altar. Come,*ln spend the night in sackcloth, you*ld who minister before my God; for*ln the grain offerings and drink offerings are*ld withheld from the house of your God.
Declare*ln a holy fast; call*ld a sacred assembly. Summon*ln the elders and*ld all who live in the land to*ln the house of the Lord*s your God, and*ld cry out to the Lord.*s
Alas*pn for that day! For*ld the day of the Lord*s is near; it*ld will come like destruction from the Almighty.
Has*pn not the food been cut off before*ld our very eyes— joy*ln and gladness from*ld the house of our God?
The*ln seeds are shriveled beneath*ld the clods. The*ln storehouses are in ruins, the*ld granaries have been broken down, for*ld the grain has dried up.
How*ln the cattle moan! The*ld herds mill about because*ln they have no pasture; even*ld the flocks of sheep are suffering.
To*pn you, Lord,*s I call, for*ld fire has devoured the pastures in the wilderness and*ld flames have burned up all the trees of the field.
Even*ln the wild animals pant for you; the*ld streams of water have dried up and*ld fire has devoured the pastures in the wilderness.
Joel 2
An Army of Locusts
Blow*pn the trumpet in Zion; sound*ld the alarm on my holy hill. Let*pn all who live in the land tremble, for*ld the day of the Lord*s is coming. It*ln is close at hand—

a*ld day of darkness and gloom, a*ld day of clouds and blackness. Like*ln dawn spreading across the mountains a*ld large and mighty army comes, such*ln as never was in ancient times nor*ld ever will be in ages to come.
Before*pn them fire devours, behind*ld them a flame blazes. Before*ln them the land is like the garden of Eden, behind*ld them, a desert waste— nothing*ld escapes them.
They*ln have the appearance of horses; they*ld gallop along like cavalry.
With*ln a noise like that of chariots they*ld leap over the mountaintops, like*ln a crackling fire consuming stubble, like*ld a mighty army drawn up for battle.
At*pn the sight of them, nations are in anguish; every*ld face turns pale.
They*ln charge like warriors; they*ld scale walls like soldiers. They*ln all march in line, not*ld swerving from their course.
They*ln do not jostle each other; each*ld marches straight ahead. They*ln plunge through defenses without*ld breaking ranks.
They*ln rush upon the city; they*ld run along the wall. They*ln climb into the houses; like*ld thieves they enter through the windows.
Before*pn them the earth shakes, the*ld heavens tremble, the*ln sun and moon are darkened, and*ld the stars no longer shine.

The*ln Lord*s thunders at*ld the head of his army; his*ln forces are beyond number, and*ld mighty is the army that obeys his command. The*ln day of the Lord*s is great; it*ld is dreadful. Who*ld can endure it?
Rend Your Heart
“Even*pn now,” declares the Lord,*s “return*ld to me with all your heart, with*ld fasting and weeping and mourning.”

Rend*pn your heart and*ld not your garments. Return*ln to the Lord*s your God, for*ld he is gracious and compassionate, slow*ln to anger and abounding in love, and*ld he relents from sending calamity.
Who*ln knows? He may turn and relent and*ld leave behind a blessing— grain*ln offerings and drink offerings for*ld the Lord*s your God.
Blow*pn the trumpet in Zion, declare*ld a holy fast, call*ld a sacred assembly.

Gather*ln the people, consecrate*ld the assembly; bring*ln together the elders, gather*ld the children, those*ld nursing at the breast. Let*ln the bridegroom leave his room and*ld the bride her chamber.

Let*ln the priests, who minister before the Lord,*s weep*ld between the portico and the altar. Let*ln them say, “Spare your people, Lord.*s Do*ld not make your inheritance an object of scorn, a*ld byword among the nations. Why*ln should they say among the peoples, ‘Where*ld is their God?’ ”
The Lord’s Answer
Then*pn the Lord*s was jealous for his land and*ld took pity on his people.
The*p Lord*s replied to them: “I*pn am sending you grain, new wine and olive oil, enough*ld to satisfy you fully; never*ln again will I make you an*ld object of scorn to the nations.

“I*pn will drive the northern horde far from you, pushing*ld it into a parched and barren land; its*ln eastern ranks will drown in the Dead Sea and*ld its western ranks in the Mediterranean Sea. And*ln its stench will go up; its*ld smell will rise.” Surely*pn he has done great things!
Do*ld not be afraid, land of Judah; be*ld glad and rejoice. Surely*ln the Lord*s has done great things!
Do*ld not be afraid, you wild animals, for*ld the pastures in the wilderness are becoming green. The*ln trees are bearing their fruit; the*ld fig tree and the vine yield their riches.

Be*ln glad, people of Zion, rejoice*ld in the Lord*s your God, for*ln he has given you the autumn rains because*ld he is faithful. He*ln sends you abundant showers, both*ld autumn and spring rains, as before.
The*ln threshing floors will be filled with grain; the*ld vats will overflow with new wine and oil.
“I*pn will repay you for the years the locusts have eaten— the*ld great locust and the young locust, the*ld other locusts and the locust swarm— my*ln great army that I sent among you.
You*ln will have plenty to eat, until you are full, and*ld you will praise the name of the Lord*s your God, who*ld has worked wonders for you; never*ln again will my people be shamed.
Then*ln you will know that I am in Israel, that*ld I am the Lord*s your God, and*ld that there is no other; never*ln again will my people be shamed.
The Day of the Lord
“And*pn afterward, I*ld will pour out my Spirit on all people. Your*ln sons and daughters will prophesy, your*ld old men will dream dreams, your*ld young men will see visions.
Even*ln on my servants, both men and women, I*ld will pour out my Spirit in those days.
I*ln will show wonders in the heavens and*ld on the earth, blood*ld and fire and billows of smoke.
The*ln sun will be turned to darkness and*ld the moon to blood before*ld the coming of the great and dreadful day of the Lord.*s

And*ln everyone who calls on*ld the name of the Lord*s will be saved; for*ln on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there*ld will be deliverance, as*ld the Lord*s has said, even*ln among the survivors whom*ld the Lord*s calls.
Joel 3
The Nations Judged
“In*pn those days and at that time, when*ld I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,

I*ln will gather all nations and*ld bring them down to the Valley of Jehoshaphat. There*ln I will put them on trial for*ld what they did to my inheritance, my people Israel, because*ln they scattered my people among the nations and*ld divided up my land.
They*ln cast lots for my people and*ld traded boys for prostitutes; they*ld sold girls for wine to drink.

“Now*p what have you against me, Tyre and Sidon and all you regions of Philistia? Are you repaying me for something I have done? If you are paying me back, I will swiftly and speedily return on your own heads what you have done.
For you took my silver and my gold and carried off my finest treasures to your temples.
You sold the people of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks, that you might send them far from their homeland.
“See,*p I am going to rouse them out of the places to which you sold them, and I will return on your own heads what you have done.
I will sell your sons and daughters to the people of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, a nation far away.” The Lord*s has spoken.
Proclaim*pn this among the nations: Prepare*ld for war! Rouse*ln the warriors! Let*ld all the fighting men draw near and attack.
Beat*ln your plowshares into swords and*ld your pruning hooks into spears. Let*ln the weakling say, “I*ld am strong!”
Come*ln quickly, all you nations from every side, and*ld assemble there. Bring*pn down your warriors, Lord!*s
“Let*pn the nations be roused; let*ld them advance into the Valley of Jehoshaphat, for*ln there I will sit to*ld judge all the nations on every side.
Swing*ln the sickle, for*ld the harvest is ripe. Come,*ln trample the grapes, for*ld the winepress is full and*ld the vats overflow— so*ln great is their wickedness!”
Multitudes,*pn multitudes in*ld the valley of decision! For*ln the day of the Lord*s is near in*ld the valley of decision.
The*ln sun and moon will be darkened, and*ld the stars no longer shine.

The*ln Lord*s will roar from Zion and*ld thunder from Jerusalem; the*ld earth and the heavens will tremble. But*ln the Lord*s will be a refuge for his people, a*ld stronghold for the people of Israel.
Blessings for God’s People
“Then*pn you will know that I, the Lord*s your God, dwell*ld in Zion, my holy hill. Jerusalem*ln will be holy; never*ld again will foreigners invade her.

“In*pn that day the mountains will drip new wine, and*ld the hills will flow with milk; all*ld the ravines of Judah will run with water. A*ln fountain will flow out of the Lord’s*s house and*ld will water the valley of acacias.
But*ln Egypt will be desolate, Edom*ld a desert waste, because*ln of violence done to the people of Judah, in*ld whose land they shed innocent blood.
Judah*ln will be inhabited forever and*ld Jerusalem through all generations.
Shall*ln I leave their innocent blood unavenged? No,*ld I will not.” The*plc Lord*s dwells in Zion!
